info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 3:08AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Maricopa County through 400 AM MST... At 307 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Paradise Valley, moving north at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Phoenix, Scottsdale, Tempe, Paradise Valley, Papago Park, Piestewa Peak Park, Deer Valley Airport, Salt River Indian Community, North Mountain Park, Downtown Scottsdale, Scottsdale Airport, Camelback Mountain, Desert Ridge Marketplace and Metro Center Mall. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 17 between mile markers 209 and 216. AZ Route 51 between mile markers 2 and 15. AZ Route 87 near mile marker 178. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
